com.appboy.ui.inappmessage

Interface IInAppMessageImmersiveView

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IInAppMessageView
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AppboyInAppMessageFullView, AppboyInAppMessageImmersiveBaseView, AppboyInAppMessageModalView

    public interface IInAppMessageImmersiveView
extends IInAppMessageView
    IInAppMessageImmersiveView is the base view interface for all immersive in-app messages.

    An immersive in-app message is defined as an in-app message that takes up the entire screen and/or 'blocks' the user from interacting with the app until the message is dismissed. Immersive views extend the base in-app message view with header text, message buttons, and a close button.

    All Known Implementing Classes: AppboyInAppMessageImmersiveBaseView AppboyInAppMessageModalView AppboyInAppMessageFullView

      Gets the message button Views so that Braze can add click listeners to them.
      android.view.View getMessageCloseButtonView()
      Gets the close button View so that Braze can add click listeners to it.
      void setupDirectionalNavigation(int numButtons)
      Sets up the directional navigation pointers needed to support d-pad/TV-remote navigation of the in-app message.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.appboy.ui.inappmessage.IInAppMessageView

        applyWindowInsets, getMessageClickableView, hasAppliedWindowInsets

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageCloseButtonView

        android.view.View getMessageCloseButtonView()
        Gets the close button View so that Braze can add click listeners to it.
        Returns:
        the child View that displays the close button.

      • getMessageButtonViews

        java.util.List<android.view.View> getMessageButtonViews(int numButtons)
        Gets the message button Views so that Braze can add click listeners to them.
        Parameters:
        numButtons - The number of visible buttons
        Returns:
        the child Views that display the message buttons. They should be returned in the same order as the List on the in-app message object so that listeners are set correctly.

      • setupDirectionalNavigation

        void setupDirectionalNavigation(int numButtons)
        Sets up the directional navigation pointers needed to support d-pad/TV-remote navigation of the in-app message. See https://developer.android.com/training/keyboard-input/navigation#Direction
        Parameters:
        numButtons - The number of MessageButton's on this message.
